meanings.sent1: She was bishoping at the church ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The priest was bishoping during the special service.
meanings.sent3: The cat bishoping around the garden looked quite regal.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was like bishoping over a chessboard, strategic and precise.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to play pretend, taking turns bishoping in their game of make-believe.

meanings.definition: The act of appointing or consecrating a bishop.
meanings.sent1: The bishoping of the new church leader was a solemn occasion.
meanings.sent2: The bishoping ceremony was attended by many faithful followers.
meanings.sent3: The bishoping event had a grand feast to celebrate the new appointment.
meanings.sent4: The bishoping of the bishop was a symbolic moment of passing on the torch.
meanings.sent5: The bishoping ritual was steeped in tradition and reverence.

meanings.definition: The process of overseeing or managing something in a bishop-like manner.
meanings.sent1: Her bishoping of the project ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The team appreciated his bishoping of the department with fairness and wisdom.
meanings.sent3: The cat's bishoping of the backyard mice population was quite effective.
meanings.sent4: She had a way of bishoping the household chores with grace and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: His bishoping of the finances saved the company from bankruptcy.
